revised_title: Microscopic Observations of Blood, Milk, Hair, and Lice
tldr: The author, M. Leewenhoeck, observes and describes the microscopic structure and growth of various biological components, including blood, milk, hair, and lice. He discovers that blood and milk are made up of small globules, hair grows through the protrusion of globules, and lice have a complex system for extracting blood and processing it internally.
